intro: Schoenus monocarpus, commonly known as the single-seeded sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces a single, elongated spike of small, inconspicuous flowers, which are typically wind-pollinated. Schoenus monocarpus is adapted to wetland environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
